source_sentence: 大方便佛報恩經卷第七
translation: Great Skillful Means Sutra on the Buddha's Repayment of Kindness, Volume 7

source_sentence: 失譯人名在後漢錄
translation: The names of the missing translators are listed in the Latter Han Register

source_sentence: 親近品第九
translation: the ninth category of proximity

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩摩訶薩知恩報恩，修大方便利益眾生，應適隨宜顯示無方。
translation: "Furthermore, the bodhisattvas know and repay kindness, cultivate great skillful means to benefit sentient beings, and display them in ways that are appropriate and suitable.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 有佛出世，號無畏王如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，應現世間，引接有緣。
translation: A Buddha arises in the world, called the Tathāgata Fearless King, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer of Husbands, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, or World Honored One, who should appear in the world and bring in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 有緣既盡，遷神涅槃。
translation: Once those conditions have ended, they'll move to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 滅度之後，於正法中有一婆羅門子，聰明黠慧，受持五戒，護持正法。
translation: After he passes away, there's a Brāhmaṇa in the right Dharma who's intelligent and wise, observes the five precepts, and protects the right Dharma.

source_sentence: 婆羅門子緣事他行，遠至餘國，到於中路，多諸賊難，有五百人共為徒侶。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa's son traveled far to another country in order to serve others, and when he arrived in the middle of the road, there were many hardships and 500 people who were his companions.

source_sentence: 前至嶮路，於頓止處，五百群賊常住其中，前後圍繞，欲劫行伴。
translation: When he reached a dangerous road, he was surrounded by a group of 500 thieves standing in front and behind him, intent on robbing his traveling companions.

source_sentence: 爾時賊主密遣一人，歷伺諸伴，應時欲發。
translation: At the time, the master of the thieves secretly sent one of them to spy on their companions and to respond to their desire.

source_sentence: 爾時賊中復有一人，先與是婆羅門子親善知識，以親善故先來告語：『善男子！
translation: At the time, there was another man among the thieves who had previously been with this Brāhmaṇa's son and was a good friend, and because he was a good friend, he first came and said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 當知於初夜時當有賊發。
translation: "You should know that thieves will appear in the early hours of the night.

source_sentence: 當時憒閙，恐相傷損，故來相告語。
translation: It's so noisy at the time that I'm afraid I'll be hurt, so I've come to tell you.

source_sentence: 汝密自作方便，遠捨而去，勿令伴知。』
translation: Make your own arrangements, and leave far away so that your companions won't know about it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時婆羅門子聞此語已，譬如人噎，既不得咽，又不得吐。
translation: "After hearing this, the Brāhmaṇa heard this, and he was like a person choking who can't swallow or spit out anything.

source_sentence: 欲告語伴，懼畏諸伴害此一人，若害此人，懼畏諸伴沒三惡道，受無量苦；若默然者，賊當害伴，若殺諸伴，賊墮三惡道，受無量苦。
translation: He wants to tell his companions that he's afraid they'll harm this person, and if they harm this person, he's afraid they'll fall into the three bad destinies and suffer immeasurable pain; if he remains silent, the thief will harm his companions, and if he kills them, the thief will fall into the three bad destinies and suffer immeasurable pain.

source_sentence: 作是念已：『我當設大方便，利益眾生，不自為己。
translation: After thinking this, he says, "I will devise great ways to benefit sentient beings, not make them my own.

source_sentence: 三惡道苦，是我所宜。』
translation: The suffering of the three evil destinies is appropriate for me.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，即便持刀斷此賊命，使諸同伴安隱無為。
translation: After thinking this, he even took his sword and cut off the thief's life, leaving his companions in peace and inaction.

source_sentence: 爾時眾伴異口同音而作是言：『大婆羅門子！
translation: The companions then spoke with one voice and said, 'Great son of a Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 卿是勝人，亦是純善之人，云何今日作此大惡？』
translation: You are an excellent person and a purely good person, why have you done this great evil today?'

source_sentence: 爾時婆羅門子，胡跪合掌，心生慙愧：『而我今日不應作惡，為利眾生及諸同伴。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then knelt down with his palms together and was deeply ashamed, 'Today, I shouldn't have done something bad for the benefit of sentient beings and my companions.'

source_sentence: 爾時眾伴復作是言：『汝自殺人，於我何益？』
translation: The companions then also said, 'What good will it do me if you kill yourself?'

source_sentence: 答眾人言：『此是惡賊，欲謀害眾伴。
translation: He answered the crowd, 'This is a vicious thief who wants to harm his companions.

source_sentence: 為是伴故，斷此人命，令伴安隱還家。
translation: For the sake of these companions, I cut off their lives and caused them to return home in peace.

source_sentence: 而我罪報，甘受地獄。』
translation: As a result, I'll be willing to go to hell as the punishment for my crimes.'

source_sentence: 爾時五百伴人舉聲大哭，悲喜交集，而作是言：『天下所重無過於命，所畏無過於死。
translation: At that point, the five hundred companions raised their voices and wept loudly, mingling with sadness and joy, and said, 'Nothing under heaven is more important than life, and nothing is more feared than death.

source_sentence: 所以然者，一切眾生皆捨金銀、珍寶、國城、妻子、衣服、飲食為救身命，我等眾伴便為更生。』
translation: That's why all sentient beings abandon gold, silver, treasure, countries, wives, clothing, and food to save their lives, and we companions are reborn.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，『此婆羅門子為眾生故，不辭眾苦及三惡報。
translation: After saying this, 'For the sake of sentient beings, this Brāhmaṇa doesn't shy away from the many pains and three bad rewards.

source_sentence: 我等今日當念重恩。
translation: Today, we must remember that great kindness.

source_sentence: 報重恩者，今當速發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。』
translation: Those of you who repay that great kindness will now quickly give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，即令發心。
translation: After saying this, they then caused them to give rise to the mind.

source_sentence: 「爾時五百群賊復作是言：『卿是勝人，純善之人，云何乃能作是大惡？』
translation: "It was then that the five hundred bandits again said, 'You're a wonderful person, a purely good person, so how could you do such great evil?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門子言：『我誠知不應作是大惡。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, 'I truly know that I shouldn't do this great evil.

source_sentence: 為欲利益一切眾生，并護汝等身命故。』
translation: It's for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings and protecting your lives.'

source_sentence: 爾時群賊而作是言：『卿自殺人，於我何益？』
translation: It was then that a group of thieves said, 'What good will it do for me if you kill someone yourself?'

source_sentence: 時婆羅門子報諸賊言：『我先知汝等在此，但我默然，不告語國王及我諸伴。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then reported to the thieves, saying, 'I knew you were here, but I kept silent and didn't tell the king or my companions about it.

source_sentence: 以是故令汝等身命安隱。』
translation: That's why I made your lives secure.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸賊聞是語已，而作是念：『我等身命便為更生。』
translation: After hearing those words, the thieves thought, 'Our bodies and lives will be reborn.'

source_sentence: 即前合掌，向是童子：『善哉大士！
translation: They then joined their palms together and said to the boy, 'Good, Maestro!

source_sentence: 修大悲者！
translation: Those who practice great compassion!

source_sentence: 願勅我等何所作為。』
translation: 'May I ask what we should do?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我所作者，唯當速發無上菩提之心。』
translation: I'll answer, 'The only thing I can do is to quickly give rise to the mind of unsurpassed enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸賊為報恩故，尋聲即發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。」
translation: It was then that the thieves, in response to their kindness, discerned the sound and immediately aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「菩薩勤求精進，欲莊嚴菩提，欲報佛恩，常當憶念一切眾生，如一子想。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "A bodhisattva who diligently seeks to make effort, wants to adorn bodhi, and wants to repay the Buddha's kindness should always remember all sentient beings as the conception of a single child.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 當知爾時婆羅門子豈異人乎？
translation: You should know, then, whether the son of Brahman was a different person.

source_sentence: 則我身是。
translation: Then I am this body.

source_sentence: 以是因緣超越九劫，疾成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, I transcend nine eons and quickly achieve unsurpassed, correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 復次，菩薩修大方便知恩報恩。
translation: Furthermore, the bodhisattva cultivates great skill in knowing and repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 佛在竹園精舍，有一比丘身患惡瘡，形體周匝膿血常流，眾所僫賤，無人親近，住在邊外朽壞房中。
translation: When the Buddha was at the Veḷuvana monastery, there was a monk who was suffering from a bad sore, whose body was surrounded by pus and blood, and who was disliked by many and not approached by anyone.

source_sentence: 爾時如來即示神力，隱蔽大眾，令無知者。
translation: The Tathāgata then demonstrated miraculous powers to hide it from the public so that no one would know about it.

source_sentence: 如來獨往病比丘所，隨其所須，取水洗之。
translation: The Tathāgata alone went to the sick monk and took as much water as he needed to wash him.

source_sentence: 思惟是已，令欲界一切諸天知之。
translation: After he thought about it, he made it known to all the gods of the desire realm.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因與諸眷屬無量百千前後圍遶，雨眾天花，作種種天樂，住虛空中。
translation: Śakrodevānām and his retinue were surrounded by measureless hundreds of thousands of people in front and behind him, raining down flowers and making all kinds of heavenly music as they stood in the sky.

source_sentence: 爾時忉利天王手持百福莊嚴微妙澡罐，盛滿清淨大悲淨水，即前奉迎，頭面禮如來足，却住一面。
translation: At the time, the king of the Heaven of Thirty-one held a subtle bathing pot filled with pure, greatly compassionate water, went forward to greet them, bowed his head and face to the Tathāgata's feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時如來即伸百福莊嚴臂，即於纖長五指放大光明，遠照諸天，大眾已集，如來躬往病比丘所，即放頂光，照病比丘。
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata then extended his hundred-foot ornamented arm, and he radiated a light from his five long, slender fingers that shone far away from the heavens. After the crowd had gathered, the Tathāgata bowed down to the sick monk and radiated a top light that shone on the sick monk.

source_sentence: 比丘遇光苦痛即除，於膿血中，而起歸命稽首，而形不隨。
translation: The monk's pain and suffering were immediately relieved when he met the light, and he rose from his pus and blood, returned to his feet, and bowed his head, but his form didn't follow him.

source_sentence: 如來即以右手，從天帝釋受取寶瓶，灌病比丘頂，左手摩拭病比丘身，身諸瘡病隨如來手尋得平復。
translation: The Tathāgata then took a jeweled vial from Indra with his right hand, poured it over the sick monk's head, and rubbed his left hand over the sick monk's body, calming the sores and ailments that followed the Tathāgata's hand.

source_sentence: 得平復已，歡喜無量：「南無釋迦牟尼！
translation: After he was calmed, he rejoiced immeasurably, "Homage to Śākyamuni!

source_sentence: 南無大慈悲父！
translation: Homage to the greatly compassionate Father!

source_sentence: 南無無上最勝醫王！
translation: Namo unsurpassed most excellent king of doctors!

source_sentence: 而我今日身病除愈，唯有心病。
translation: Today, my physical illness has been healed, but I have only a mental illness.

source_sentence: 如來今者，為憐愍故，施我法藥，除我身心所有重患。」
translation: Now, for pity's sake, the Tathāgata has given me the Dharma medicine to remove all my serious physical and mental ailments."

source_sentence: 爾時如來告病比丘：「如來今者念汝重恩；如來今者欲報汝恩。」
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata addressed the sick monk, "Now, the Tathāgata is mindful of your great kindness; now, the Tathāgata wants to repay your kindness."

source_sentence: 爾時病比丘驚喜無量。
translation: The sick monk was then overjoyed beyond measure.

source_sentence: 佛時即為示教利喜，比丘歡喜，即得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫。
translation: The Buddha then showed him how to teach and rejoice, and the monk rejoiced and attained the fruit of the arhat, with the three insights, six supernormal powers, and eight liberations.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因及諸眷屬，無量諸天皆墮疑網：「如來云何枉屈神德，洗病比丘瘡痍膿血，云言報恩？
translation: Śakrodevānām, his retinue, and measureless gods all fell into a web of doubt, "How did the Tathāgata bend his spiritual virtue in vain to wash the sick monk's sores, pus, and blood, and how did he say he was repaying you for your kindness?

source_sentence: 其事云何，願為我等分別解說。」
translation: What are these things? Would you please explain them for us?"

source_sentence: 佛告釋提桓因及諸天人大眾：「汝等善聽！
translation: The Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra and the great multitude of gods, "Listen well, you guys!

source_sentence: 當為汝說宿世之事。
translation: I'll explain the events of past lives for you.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因！
translation: Śakrodevānām!

source_sentence: 乃往過去無量阿僧祇劫，爾時有王，惡逆無道，非理壓伏，逼奪取財。
translation: It was an incalculably long time ago when there was a king who was wicked and amoral, unreasonably subdued, and forced to seize property.

source_sentence: 爾時惡王與一五百，深心相知，密共要言：『若當有人犯官事者，汝當苦治，威恩隨汝。
translation: At the time, the evil king and 1,500 people knew each other intimately and shared a secret request, saying, 'If someone violates the rules, you must punish them with pain and follow them with authority and kindness.

source_sentence: 若得財賄，與我共之。』
translation: If you get a bribe for your money, share it with me.'

source_sentence: 爾時五百常行鞭杖，得財多者，便令不著；若無財者，或致失命，以此為常。
translation: The five hundred then always whipped and caned, making it so that those who had more money wouldn't be attached and those who didn't have money might lose their lives, and that was always the case.

source_sentence: 時有優婆塞犯小官事，將付五百，應受鞭楚。
translation: An Upāsaka then committed a minor official offense and sent 500 to be whipped and slapped.

source_sentence: 聞是優婆塞是好善人，便令無著於楚毒中，而得脫難。
translation: Hearing that the upāsaka was a good person, he made himself unattached to the pain and got out of trouble.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，歡喜無量。
translation: Because of this, they rejoiced immeasurably.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 當知爾時五百者，今病比丘是；優婆塞者，今我身是。
translation: You should know that at the time, the 500 were now the sick monks, and the upāsaka was now me.

source_sentence: 是故菩薩於無量阿僧祇劫輕恩重報，乃至正覺心常不忘。」
translation: Therefore, throughout measureless incalculably long eons, the bodhisattva despises kindnesses and rewards them with respect, even up to the point of correct awakening, and his mind never forgets them."

source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因及無量天眾歡喜無量，有四萬八千諸天發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra and measureless gods rejoiced incalculably, and 48,000 gods aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 發菩提心已，作天伎樂，各還所止。
translation: After they had aroused the mind of enlightenment, they created celestial music and returned to their lodging.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「若有善男子、善女人知恩報恩，當行四事：一者，親近善友；二者，至心聽法；三者，思惟其義；四者，如說修行。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "If good sons and good women know and repay kindness, they should do four things: 1) draw near to good friends; 2) listen wholeheartedly to the teaching; 3) contemplate its meaning; and 4) practice it as it's taught.

source_sentence: 復有四法：一者，隨法不隨人；二者，隨義不隨字；三者，隨智不隨識；四者，隨了義經，不隨不了義經。
translation: There are also four things: one, follow the teaching and not the person; two, follow the meaning and not the words; three, follow wisdom and not consciousness; and four, follow the fully explained sūtras and not the incomplete sūtras.

source_sentence: 行此八法，名為知恩。
translation: Doing these eight things is called knowing kindness.

source_sentence: 復行八法，是名報恩。
translation: Also, practicing these eight things is called repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 何等為八？
translation: What are the eight?

source_sentence: 一者，利；二者，衰；三者，毀；四者，譽；五者，稱；六者，譏；七者，苦；八者，樂。
translation: The first is benefit; the second is loss; the third is disgrace; the fourth is praise; the fifth is praise; the sixth is ridicule; the seventh is pain; and the eighth is pleasure.

source_sentence: 復行四事，是名知恩，亦名報恩：一者，見惡眾生，心生憐愍，以修慈因緣故；二者，見苦眾生，目不暫捨，起悲因緣故；三者，見師長、父母、有德之人，心情歡悅，起喜因緣故；四者，見怨家眾生，心不瞋恚，修捨因緣故。」
translation: Again, these four things are called knowing kindness and repaying kindness: first, when they see unwholesome sentient beings, their hearts become compassionate because they cultivate the causes and conditions of kindness; second, when they see suffering sentient beings, their eyes don't momentarily abandon them because they give rise to the causes and conditions of pity; third, when they see teachers, parents, or people of virtue, their moods are joyous because they give rise to the causes and conditions of joy; and fourth, when they see resentful sentient beings, their hearts aren't angry because they cultivate the causes and conditions of equanimity."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難即整衣服，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Ānanda adjusted his clothes and went forward to say to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來初發菩提心時，知恩報恩，行初四事，其義云何？」
translation: What is the meaning of the first four things that a Tathāgata does when he first arouses the aspiration for enlightenment and knows and repays kindness?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「乃往過去無量阿僧祇劫，爾時有佛出世，名毗婆尸如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，出興于世，教導有緣。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "It was an incalculably long time ago when a Buddha appeared in the world named Vipaśyin Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfectly Virtuous, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer of Beings, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One, who appeared in the world and taught those who had conditions.

source_sentence: 有緣已盡，遷神涅槃。
translation: Once their conditions have ended, they move to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 正法、像法滅已，有國名波羅奈，人民熾盛，國土豐熟。
translation: After the right teaching and the teaching of images ceased, there was a country named Vārāṇasī, whose people flourished and whose land was abundant.

source_sentence: 其王常以正法治國，不柱人民。
translation: Its king always rules the country correctly and doesn't pillar the people.

source_sentence: 其國有山，名仙聖山。
translation: There was a mountain in that country named Mount Xianshō.

source_sentence: 其山常有五百辟支佛止住其中，多有五通神仙亦住其中。
translation: On that mountain, there are always 500 pratyekabuddhas standing there, and many of the five supernormal celestials also live there.

source_sentence: 爾時多有諸禽獸等，而來依附。
translation: At the time, there were many animals and creatures that came to depend on them.

source_sentence: 有一師子，名曰堅誓，身毛金色，有大威武，力敵於千，發聲哮吼，飛鳥墮落，走獸隱伏。
translation: There was a lion named Sthiramati, with golden hair and a body of great authority that was equal in strength to a thousand, who raised his voice and roared, causing flying birds to fall and animals to retreat.

source_sentence: 遊行山澤，見一辟支佛沙門，威儀清淨。
translation: Wandering through the mountains and swamps, he saw a pratyekabuddha ascetic with pure demeanor.

source_sentence: 見已心喜，日日親近，常聞誦經，說微妙法。
translation: He was delighted by what he saw, and he became intimate with him day after day, always listening to and reciting the sūtras and teaching the subtle Dharma.

source_sentence: 「爾時有大獵師，見是師子，身毛金色，心生歡喜，而作是念：『我若得此師子，剝取其皮，奉上國王，必施爵祿，七世無乏。』
translation: "It was then that a great hunter saw this lion with golden hair on his body and rejoiced, thinking, 'If I were to obtain this lion and skin him, I would present his hide to the king and be rewarded with an honorable position that wouldn't be lacking for seven generations.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，復發是言：『堅誓師子，獸中之王，弓箭所不及，弶網所不制。
translation: After thinking this, he then said, 'The lion of strong vows is the king of beasts, invulnerable to bows and arrows and unstoppable by snares.

source_sentence: 我今復當更設異計。
translation: Now, I will again devise a different plan.

source_sentence: 堅誓師子所敬望者乃是沙門，我今當作沙門之像，密弓射之。
translation: The one whom the lion of firm vows looks up to is an ascetic, so now I'll take his image and shoot it with a closed bow.

source_sentence: 袈裟覆上，細視徐行，往詣樹下，彼若見我，必來親附。
translation: Putting my robe over him, I'll take a close look and walk slowly to the foot of a tree; if he sees me, he'll surely come and get close to me.

source_sentence: 以親近已，便復挽弓，藥箭射之，萬無不獲。』
translation: After I get close to them, I'll then draw my bow and shoot a medicinal arrow at them, and nothing will be impossible for me to achieve.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，即便還家，而唱是言：『祖先已來，歷世相承，常為獵師，未曾聞獸，身毛金色，況復見之？
translation: After he thought about that, he even returned home and said, 'My ancestors have been hunting masters for generations, but I've never heard of an animal with golden hair, so how could I see it?'

source_sentence: 今欲獵取。』
translation: Now, I want to hunt for it.'

source_sentence: 即剃鬚髮而被法服，如所思惟，還入山中，坐一樹下。
translation: He shaved his hair, put on the monastic robes, did as he had thought, went back into the mountains, and sat under a tree.

source_sentence: 爾時堅誓師子見是比丘，心生歡喜，騰躍親附，舐比丘足。
translation: Seeing this monk, the lion of firm vows rejoiced, leaped up, kissed him, and licked his feet.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師即便射之。
translation: The hunter then shot him.

source_sentence: 既被毒箭，嘊喍哮吼，欲前搏撮。
translation: He was then attacked by a man who had been shot, and he started to snarl.

source_sentence: 臨欲毀害，復作是念：『此是沙門！
translation: When he was about to kill him, he thought, "That's an ascetic!

source_sentence: 被壞色衣，是三世佛賢聖幖幟。
translation: Being clothed in damaged form is the corrugated boards of the good and noble buddhas of the three times.

source_sentence: 我今若害，不足為難，若奪其命，便奪諸佛賢聖幖相。』
translation: If I harm them now, it wouldn't be enough of a problem, but if I take their lives, I'll be taking away the corrugated boards of the good and noble buddhas.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，飲氣忍苦。
translation: After thinking about this, he tolerated the suffering by drinking his energy.

source_sentence: 復經少時，毒藥轉深，苦痛難忍。
translation: After a little while, the poison became deeper and the pain became unbearable.

source_sentence: 思惟是已，復欲搏嚙，復發是言：『不足為難。
translation: After thinking about it, he wanted to fight again, and then he said, 'That's not difficult enough.

source_sentence: 若毀害者，諸佛賢聖之所呵責。
translation: If someone were to harm them, the buddhas, good men, and sages would rebuke them.

source_sentence: 又復世間善惡不別，此是惡人，懷毒陰謀，欲來害我；我若不忍，與彼惡人，則無有異。
translation: Furthermore, there's no distinction between good and evil in the world; this is a bad person who harbors a poisonous plot to harm me; if I don't tolerate it, I won't be any different from that bad person.

source_sentence: 修忍之人，一切愛敬；不忍之人，眾所憎惡，增長煩惱，長煩惱故，生死增長；長生死故，生諸難處；生難處故，遠離善友；遠善友故，不聞正法；不聞法故，重翳疑網；以疑網故，遠離阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Those who cultivate patience are loved by all, but those who don't cultivate patience are hated by many and grow afflicted. As a result of long-standing afflictions, birth and death increase; as a result of long birth and death, birth in difficult places; as a result of birth in difficult places, I'm far from good friends; as a result of being far from good friends, I don't hear the right teaching; as a result of not hearing the teaching, I'm heavily blinded by the web of doubt; and as a result of the web of doubt, I'm far from unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 是故我今不應起惡。』
translation: Therefore, I shouldn't give rise to evil now.'

source_sentence: 「作是念已，即說偈言：「『願自喪身命，　　終不起惡心，　　向於壞色服；　　願自喪身命，　　終不起惡心，　　向於出家人。』
translation: "After that thought, he spoke in verse, saying, "May I lose my life and never become evil-minded and turn to clothing of bad form, and may I lose my life and never become evil-minded and turn to becoming a renunciant."

source_sentence: 「說是偈已，即便命終。
translation: "After speaking this verse, he even let his life end.

source_sentence: 天地六反震動，驚諸禽獸，四散馳走；無雲雨血，日無精光。
translation: The six terrors in heaven and earth shook, startling the animals and scattering them, and there were no clouds, rain, or blood, and the sun had no radiance.

source_sentence: 「爾時獵師即脫被服，持刀剝之，擔負還歸。
translation: "The hunter then took off his robe, took his sword and stripped him, and returned home with a load.

source_sentence: 既至家已，奉上國王。
translation: When he arrived home, he presented it to the king.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜，問諸臣言：『我從生來，未聞畜獸身毛金色，如何今日親自眼見？
translation: The king was delighted when he saw them and asked his ministers, 'Since I was born, I've never heard of an animal with golden hair, so how is it that I've seen it myself today?'

source_sentence: 奇哉！
translation: Amazing!

source_sentence: 怪哉！』
translation: strange!'

source_sentence: 徐問獵師：『以何方便，而得是皮？』
translation: Xu asked the hunter, 'What is the method by which this skin was obtained?'

source_sentence: 爾時獵師即前白王：『唯願大王賜我無畏，當以上事向大王說。』
translation: The hunter then went forward and said to the king, 'Please grant me fearlessness, Your Majesty, and I will tell the king the above.'

source_sentence: 王言：『隨汝所願！』
translation: The king said, 'Do as you wish!'

source_sentence: 爾時獵師具以上事向大王說。
translation: It was then that the hunter explained all of the above to the king.

source_sentence: 「王聞是語，心生憂惱，譬如人噎，既不得咽，又不得吐。
translation: "When the king heard those words, his heart became distressed, like a person who's choking and can neither swallow nor vomit.

source_sentence: 即出，宣令一切大臣及諸小王大眾已集，即自宣言：『諸君！
translation: He then went out and summoned all the ministers and minor kings to the assembly, and he declared to himself, 'Gentlemen!

source_sentence: 當知我曾從智者聞如是語：「若有畜獸，身毛金色，必是菩薩。
translation: You should know that I once heard this from a wise man, "Suppose there's an animal with golden hair on its body that must be a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 若一眾生發菩提心，令一切眾生得大利益。」
translation: If one sentient being gives rise to the mind of bodhi, it will cause all sentient beings to attain great benefit."

source_sentence: 如何今日，是惡獵師，設是方便，殺是菩薩？
translation: Today, how did this bad hunter devise this method to kill this bodhisattva?

source_sentence: 我今若以官爵、俸祿、象馬、七珍、衣服、飲食、錢財、穀帛賜是惡人，則與彼一道共為勞侶。』
translation: Now, if I were to give this bad man an official title, salary, elephant or horse, seven valuables, clothing, food and drink, money, and grain, then I'd be a fellow laborer with him.'

source_sentence: 思惟是已，即取獵師，奪其命根。
translation: After thinking this, he then took the hunter and snatched his life force.

source_sentence: 持師子皮，還入山中，到尸骸所，即以牛頭栴檀聚而成[卄/積]，以火闍維師子皮骨，收取舍利，起塔供養。」
translation: Taking the lion's skin, he went back into the mountains and went to the corpse, gathered a [20/gathering] of ox-head sandalwood, maintained the lion's skin and bones in a fire, collected the relics, and raised a stūpa to make offerings."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 堅誓師子者，今則我身釋迦文是。
translation: "That firmly vowed lion is now Śākyamuni, who is myself.

source_sentence: 菩薩如是親近善友，乃至喪命，終不起惡。
translation: Thus, a bodhisattva becomes intimate with a good friend, and even when he dies, he never does evil.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 為知恩報恩故。
translation: "It's because they know they're being rewarded for their kindness.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 菩薩得近善知識故，能速成辦阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Because a bodhisattva gets close to a good teacher, he can quickly accomplish supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩常勤求善知識，為聞佛法，乃至一句一偈一義，三界煩惱，皆悉萎悴。
translation: When a bodhisattva always diligently seeks a good teacher in order to hear the Buddha's teaching, even a single word or verse or meaning, the three realms of affliction all wither.

source_sentence: 菩薩至心求佛語時，渴法情重，不惜身命，設踐熱鐵，猛火之地，不以為患。
translation: When a bodhisattva wholeheartedly seeks the Buddha's words, his thirst for the Dharma is so great that he doesn't spare his own life; even if he were to trample on hot iron or stand on a fierce fire, it wouldn't bother him.

source_sentence: 菩薩為一偈故，尚不惜命，況十二部經？
translation: A bodhisattva wouldn't spare his life for the sake of a single verse, so why wouldn't he spare the lives of 12 sūtras?

source_sentence: 為一偈故，尚不惜身命，況餘財物？
translation: For the sake of a single verse, they wouldn't spare their lives, so why would they spare the rest of their possessions?

source_sentence: 聞法利故，身得安樂，深生信心，直心正見。
translation: As a result of hearing the benefits of the teaching, they attain physical well-being, deeply believe, and straighten their minds with right view.

source_sentence: 見說法者，如見父母，心無憍慢。
translation: Seeing someone who teaches the Dharma as they see their father and mother, their mind is free of pride.

source_sentence: 為眾生故，至心聽法，不為利養；為眾生故，不為自利；為正法故，不畏王難，飢渴寒熱，虎狼、惡獸、盜賊等事。
translation: For the sake of sentient beings, they wholeheartedly listen to the teaching, not for profit; for the sake of sentient beings, not for their own benefit; and for the sake of the right teaching, they aren't afraid of such things as the king's difficulties, hunger, thirst, cold, heat, tigers, wolves, harsh animals, and thieves.

source_sentence: 先自調伏煩惱諸根，然後聽法，非時不聽。
translation: He first disciplines his own afflicted faculties, and then he listens to the teaching, not when it's not the right time to listen.

source_sentence: 至心聽法，恭敬說者，尊重於法，是名菩薩知恩報恩。
translation: This is called a bodhisattva who whole-heartedly listens to the teaching, respects what's said, and venerates the teaching, which is called knowing and repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 「云何菩薩至心聽法？
translation: "How does a bodhisattva wholeheartedly listen to the teaching?

source_sentence: 聽法有四：一者，至心；二者，一心；三者，一切心；四者，善心。
translation: There are four ways to listen to the teaching: one, the ultimate mind; two, one mind; three, all minds; and four, good minds.

source_sentence: 是名菩薩勤求十二部經。
translation: This is called a bodhisattva diligently seeking the 12 sutras.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 念佛重恩，為欲流布諸佛正法，為欲增長諸佛法故，為令世間信佛法故，為令一切無量眾生悉得無上菩提道故，是故菩薩念十方無量諸眾生故，為報諸佛之重恩故，是故菩薩所以勤求十二部經。
translation: Being mindful of the Buddha's great kindness, in order to spread his true teaching, in order to increase the Buddha's teaching, in order to make the world believe in the Buddha's teaching, and in order to cause all sentient beings without measure to attain the unsurpassed path of enlightenment, the bodhisattva is mindful of the countless sentient beings in the ten directions, and in order to repay the Buddha's great kindness, the bodhisattva therefore diligently seeks the twelve sūtras.

source_sentence: 「菩薩何故勤求佛法？
translation: "Why do bodhisattvas diligently pursue the Buddha's teaching?

source_sentence: 欲令眾生生信心故，是故求於因論；為知諸過罪故，為破外道惡邪論故，為知方便調眾生故，為欲分別如來語義、世語義故，是故菩薩求於因論。
translation: Because they want to cause sentient beings to have faith, they therefore pursue theories of cause; because they want to know about faults and sins, because they want to refute the mistaken theories of non-Buddhists, because they want to know how to skillfully tame sentient beings, and because they want to discern the meaning of the Tathāgata's words and the meaning of worldly speech, the bodhisattva therefore pursues theories of cause.

source_sentence: 菩薩何故求於聲論？
translation: Why do bodhisattvas pursue the śrāvaka theory?

source_sentence: 為令言辭淨莊嚴故，不淨之言不能宣說明了義故；為欲解知一切義故；不壞正語，憍慢心故；破於邪見，為知方便調眾生故，是故菩薩求於聲論。
translation: Because words are purified and adorned, because impure words can't explain the clear meaning, because they want to understand all meanings, because they don't undermine right speech and arrogance, and because they refute wrong views and tame sentient beings with knowledge and skill, the bodhisattva seeks to engage in the discourse on sound.

source_sentence: 菩薩何故求諸醫方？
translation: Why do bodhisattvas seek medical advice?

source_sentence: 為令眾生離諸惡不善四百四病故，為憐愍一切眾生，為令生信心故。
translation: It's for the sake of ridding sentient beings of the four hundred and four bad and unskillful diseases, for the sake of pitying all sentient beings, and for the sake of generating faith.

source_sentence: 既得離患心，生歡喜故。
translation: Once they attain freedom from suffering, they become joyous.

source_sentence: 以得歡喜，心常念諸佛大悲，度眾生故，是故菩薩求諸醫方。
translation: Because they attain joy, their mind is always mindful of the great compassion of the buddhas and their desire to save sentient beings, so the bodhisattva seeks medical prescriptions.

source_sentence: 菩薩何故求世方術？
translation: Why do bodhisattvas seek worldly prescriptions?

source_sentence: 為易得財，利眾生故；為眾生生信心故；為知世事，破憍慢故；調伏眾生故；知一切法，調闇障故。
translation: It's because it's easy to get possessions and benefits sentient beings, because it creates faith in sentient beings, because it's knowledge of worldly affairs that breaks down pride, because it tames sentient beings, and because it's knowledge of all things that tames the hindrances of darkness.

source_sentence: 若有菩薩，不能如是求五事者，終不能得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，成一切智。
translation: If a bodhisattva doesn't pursue these five things in this way, he or she will never attain supreme perfect enlightenment and accomplish omniscience.

source_sentence: 為得無上菩提故，求於五事。
translation: Seeking these five things is the reason for attaining unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「菩薩知恩報恩者，為眾生說。
translation: "A bodhisattva who knows and repays kindnesses will explain them for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 說何事？
translation: What things does it explain?

source_sentence: 云何說？
translation: How do you explain it?

source_sentence: 說何事謂十二部經；云何說謂成就五事，為得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: "What's explained as the twelve scriptures and what's explained as the accomplishment of five things in order to attain supreme perfect enlightenment?

source_sentence: 說有二事：一者，次第說；二者，清淨說。
translation: There are two things that are explained: first, that they are explained in sequence; and second, that they are explained in a pure way.

source_sentence: 次第說者：初說檀波羅蜜，次說尸波羅蜜乃至般若波羅蜜。
translation: Those who explain them sequentially say, "First, I'll explain the perfection of giving, then I'll explain the perfection of morality and even the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 為知恩報恩故，思惟其義，如法而住，是名次第說。
translation: To know and repay kindness, contemplate its meaning, and abide in it according to the teaching is called sequential explanation.

source_sentence: 清淨說者：聽者坐，說者立，不應為說；若聽者求於法過，求說者過，不應為說；若聽者依人不依法，不依法者，不應為說；若聽者依字不依義，不應為說；乃至聽者不依了義經者，不應為說。
translation: Purified speakers: If a listener sits and a speaker stands, they shouldn't speak; if a listener seeks faults in the teaching and seeks faults in the speaker, they shouldn't speak; if a listener relies on someone other than the teaching and doesn't follow the teaching, they shouldn't speak; if a listener relies on the words but doesn't rely on the meaning, they shouldn't speak; even if a listener doesn't rely on a sūtra that fully explains the meaning, they shouldn't speak.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是人不能恭敬諸佛菩薩清淨法故。
translation: That person doesn't respect the pure Dharma of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 若說法者尊重於法，聽法之人亦生宗敬，至心聽受，不生輕慢，是名清淨說法。
translation: If a Dharma preacher respects the Dharma, and those who hear the Dharma develop respect for it, listen with utmost attention, and don't become dismissive, this is called a pure teaching.

source_sentence: 次第說者，一切說。
translation: Someone who teaches in sequence will teach everything.

source_sentence: 一切說者，謂十二部經，乃至一句一偈，乃至半偈。
translation: Everything that's said refers to the 12 sūtras, even a sentence, a verse, or even half a verse.

source_sentence: 若辭若義若法，於其法義示教利喜時，或時呵責，或時真說，或時喻說，隨所應說；或淺近說，或易入說，隨所樂聞，是名菩薩知恩報恩次第說法。
translation: Whether it's expressed in words, meanings, or teachings that benefit and delight others, sometimes rebuked, sometimes truly explained, or sometimes explained metaphorically, as appropriate, or explained in a simple or accessible way, as pleasing to hear, this is called a bodhisattva knowing and repaying kindness by teaching in sequence.

source_sentence: 清淨說者，菩薩摩訶薩於怨憎中，修習慈心。
translation: A pure teaching is one in which the bodhisattva Mahāsattva cultivates a mind of kindness in the midst of enmity.

source_sentence: 得慈心已，於惡眾生及放逸人，以諸方便而為說法，乃至愛樂其心慢恣及貧窮人，方便開示，而為說法，不為讚己、毀他、飲食、利養、名譽故，是名菩薩知恩報恩清淨說法。
translation: After attaining the mind of kindness, he explains the teaching to unruly sentient beings and careless people with various skillful means, even to the point of delighting in the conceit of laziness of mind and the poor, explaining it skillfully and explaining it for the sake of not praising himself, disparaging others, eating and drinking, making profit, or praising reputation, which is called the pure teaching of the bodhisattva who knows and repays kindness.

source_sentence: 云何如法住？
translation: How does he abide according to the teaching?

source_sentence: 身口意業修習善法，具足清淨，知恩報恩，為莊嚴阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故。
translation: They cultivate good qualities in body, speech, and mental activity, perfect their purity, and know and repay kindness in order to adorn the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩摩訶薩知恩報恩，思惟其義，多聞逮得總持，熾然法炬。
translation: "Furthermore, knowing and repaying kindness, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva contemplates its meaning, is well-versed, acquires a mastery, and blazes the torch of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 為利益一切眾生，應當修施戒多聞。
translation: To benefit all sentient beings, they should cultivate generosity, observe precepts, and be well-versed.

source_sentence: 供養說者，不求法過及說者過，無有害心，施眾生無畏，是名知恩；受人天樂，得道涅槃，是名報恩。
translation: Making offerings to speakers, not seeking faults with the teaching or with speakers, and having no harmful thoughts and bestowing fearlessness on sentient beings is called knowing kindness; accepting the pleasures of humans and gods and attaining the path to nirvāṇa is called repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 菩薩復有四種，修於忍辱，破壞不忍，莊嚴菩提，攝取眾生。
translation: There are also four kinds of bodhisattvas who cultivate forbearance, disrupt intolerance, adorn bodhi, and gather sentient beings.

source_sentence: 令修忍辱，若自忍，若使他忍，遠離怖畏，是名知恩。
translation: Causing someone to cultivate forbearance, whether it's forbearance on their part or forbearance in others, and to be free of fear is called knowing kindness.

source_sentence: 以忍辱因緣，無有瞋心，眷屬不壞，不受苦惱，心無悔恨；捨是身已，受人天樂，速得涅槃樂，是名報恩。
translation: Because of forbearance, there's no anger, their retinue doesn't break up, they don't suffer pain, and they have no remorse in their hearts; after abandoning this body, they'll experience the pleasures of humans and gods and quickly attain the happiness of nirvāṇa, which is called repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩復有四事，勤修精進，破壞懈怠，莊嚴菩提，攝取眾生。
translation: There are four more things that bodhisattvas do to diligently cultivate effort, destroy laziness, adorn bodhi, and gather sentient beings.

source_sentence: 為菩提道，令修精進；臥安覺安，離諸煩惱；增長善法，身受安樂，是名自利。
translation: Making effort for the path to enlightenment, lying down and feeling comfortable, and secluding themselves from afflictions, and increasing good qualities and experiencing physical well-being are called self-benefiting.

source_sentence: 菩薩精進，不惱眾生，打擲呵罵，是名利他。
translation: A bodhisattva's effort not to annoy sentient beings or hurl insults at them is called improving others.

source_sentence: 捨是身已，受人天樂，身得大力，獲菩提道，是名大果，是名菩薩精進四事。
translation: After abandoning this body, he experiences the happiness of humans and gods, attains great physical strength, and acquires the path to enlightenment, which is called the great result, and these are called the four things that a bodhisattva makes effort to do.

source_sentence: 菩薩修定，破壞亂心，莊嚴菩提，攝取眾生。
translation: A bodhisattva cultivates concentration, destroys distractions, adorns bodhi, and gathers sentient beings.

source_sentence: 為菩提道，令修禪定，現受世樂，身心寂靜，是名知恩。
translation: To cultivate meditation for the path to enlightenment, cause them to experience worldly pleasures in the present, and have tranquility of body and mind is called knowing kindness.

source_sentence: 以身心寂靜，故不惱眾生，是名報恩報恩。
translation: Because their body and mind are still, they don't disturb sentient beings, which is called repaying kindness and returning kindness.

source_sentence: 菩薩捨是身已，受清淨身，安隱快樂，得大涅槃，是名菩薩禪定四事。
translation: After the bodhisattva gives up this body, he receives a pure body, is comfortable and happy, and attains great nirvāṇa, which are called the four things of bodhisattva meditation.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩知恩報恩，成就智慧，破壞無明，莊嚴菩提，以四攝法攝取眾生。
translation: "Furthermore, knowing and repaying kindness, the bodhisattva accomplishes wisdom, destroys ignorance, adorns bodhi, and collects sentient beings with the four methods of collecting them.

source_sentence: 為菩提道，修行智慧，以知法界故，受身安樂，是名自利。
translation: Cultivating wisdom for the path to enlightenment and cultivating wisdom to know the Dharma realm and experience physical well-being is called self-benefiting.

source_sentence: 能發眾生世間之事及出世事，是名利他。
translation: Being able to motivate sentient beings to perform worldly and supramundane tasks is called improving others.

source_sentence: 能壞煩惱智慧二障，是名大果，是名知恩，是名報恩。
translation: Being able to destroy the two hindrances of afflictive wisdom is called the great fruit, knowing kindness, and repaying kindness.

source_sentence: 菩薩智慧四事不可思議。
translation: These four things of bodhisattva's wisdom are unfathomable.

source_sentence: 「復次，菩薩非宿命智，知宿世之事，為觀眾生善惡諸業同受善者。
translation: "Furthermore, the bodhisattva doesn't have knowledge of past lives, knows past-life events, and is a recipient of goodness in the form of good and bad actions for audience members.

source_sentence: 為欲利益一切眾生故，菩薩摩訶薩以大方便，處兜率天，成就壽命，有三事勝：一者，壽勝；二者，色勝；三者，名稱勝。
translation: Because he wants to benefit all sentient beings, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva uses great skill to go to Tuṣita Heaven and achieve a life span that's superior in three ways: first, superior in longevity; second, superior in appearance; and third, superior in reputation.

source_sentence: 初下之時，放大光明，遍照十方；自知始入母胞胎時、住時、出時；於十方面行七步時，無人扶持，作如是言：『我今此身是最後邊。』
translation: When he first descends, he radiates a bright light that shines everywhere in the ten directions; he knows when he first enters his mother's womb, when he stands, and when he exits; and when he takes seven steps in each of the ten directions without support, he says, 'Now, this body of mine is the last limit.'

source_sentence: 諸天、鬼神、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽，以諸華香、微妙伎樂、幡蓋供養；三十二相莊嚴其身，無能勝者；以慈善力壞魔兵眾；一一支節同那羅延所得大力；童齓之年，不學世事，而能知之；無師而學，自然而得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；梵天勸請，為諸眾生轉正法輪；正受三昧，雷聲震吼，不能令動；諸獸親附，愛如父母，畜生奉食，佛知心故；雲神降雨，洗浴其身，樹垂曲枝，蔭翳其軀。
translation: The gods, demons, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas offer their support with flowers, incense, subtle music, and banners; they adorn their bodies with thirty-two forms that are unsurpassed; they subdue armies of Māra with the power of charity; they match the strength of the one arm that Nārāyaṇa attains; they are young and able to understand worldly affairs when they're young and have never studied them; they train without a teacher and naturally attain supreme, perfect enlightenment; they're encouraged by the Brahmā gods to turn the right wheel of the Dharma for sentient beings; they're properly trained in samādhi, which cannot be moved by the sound of thunder; they're followed by animals that love them like parents, and animals that feed them because the Buddha knows their minds; the cloud gods send rain to wash their bodies, and trees hang twisted branches that shade their bodies.

source_sentence: 既成道已，六年之中，魔常伺求，不得其短；常在禪定，成就念心，善能了知，覺觀起滅，是名菩薩共生不可思議。
translation: After attaining the Way, for six years Māra is always searching for him but doesn't get the short end of the stick; he's always in meditation, accomplishes mindfulness, and is able to well understand and perceive arising and ceasing, which is called inconceivable co-production by a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 不共生者，為欲利益一切眾生，如彼狂人；緣見如來，還得本心；盲者得眼，倒產得順，聾者得聽，貪瞋癡者悉得除滅，是名不共生不可思議。
translation: That person who doesn't share common birth wants to benefit all sentient beings like that crazy person; when they see the Tathāgata, they regain their original mind, the blind get eyesight, the mistaken get compliance, the deaf get hearing, and the greedy and the deluded are all removed is called the unfathomable condition of not sharing common birth.

source_sentence: 「又共生者，如來所行，不可思議。
translation: "Also, when there's co-arising, what the Tathāgata does is inconceivable.

source_sentence: 常右脇臥，如師子王；若草若葉，無有動亂；旋藍猛風不動衣服；發足行步，如師子王、白鵝王等；若欲行時，先發右足；所行之處，高下皆平；食無完過，遺粒在口，是名共生不可思議。
translation: Always lying on his right side like the lion king, his grass and leaves don't stir, and the swirling blue wind doesn't move his clothes; when he arouses his feet to walk, he walks like the lion king or the white goose king; when he wants to walk, he first arouses his right foot; wherever he walks, his height is even; and there's nothing left to eat that's in his mouth, which is called the inconceivable condition of co-arising.

source_sentence: 復次，共生不可思議：一者，足下平；二者，足下千輻輪；三者，指纖長；四者，足跟傭滿；五者，指網縵；六者，手足柔軟；七者，傭[蹲-酋+(十/田/ㄙ)]腸，如伊尼延鹿王；八者，踝骨不現；九者，平立手摩於膝；十者，陰藏相，如象馬王；十一者，身圓滿足，如尼拘陀樹；十二者，身毛上靡；十三者，一一毛右旋；十四者，身真金色；十五者，常光各一尋；十六者，皮膚細軟，塵垢不著；十七者，七處滿；十八者，上身如師子；十九者，臂肘傭圓；二十者，缺骨平滿；二十一者，得身傭相；二十二者，口四十齒；二十三者，齒密不踈而齊平；二十四者，齒色白；二十五者，頰車方如師子；二十六者，味中得上味；二十七者，肉髻相；二十八者，廣長舌；二十九者，梵音聲；三十者，目紺青色；三十一者，眼如牛王；三十二者，眉間白毫——如是八十種不可思議相好。
translation: 復次，共生不可思議：一者，足下平；二者，足下千輻輪；三者，指纖長；四者，足跟傭滿；五者，指網縵；六者，手足柔軟；七者，傭[蹲-酋+(十/田/ㄙ)]腸，如伊尼延鹿王；八者，踝骨不現；九者，平立手摩於膝；十者，陰藏相，如象馬王；十一者，身圓滿足，如尼拘陀樹；十二者，身毛上靡；十三者，一一毛右旋；十四者，身真金色；十五者，常光各一尋；十六者，皮膚細軟，塵垢不著；十七者，七處滿；十八者，上身如師子；十九者，臂肘傭圓；二十者，缺骨平滿；二十一者，得身傭相；二十二者，口四十齒；二十三者，齒密不踈而齊平；二十四者，齒色白；二十五者，頰車方如師子；二十六者，味中得上味；二十七者，肉髻相；二十八者，廣長舌；二十九者，梵音聲；三十者，目紺青色；三十一者，眼如牛王；三十二者，眉間白毫——如是八十種不可思議相好。

source_sentence: 一一相好復有無量百千種微妙相好。
translation: Each one of these features also has measureless hundreds of thousands of subtle features.

source_sentence: 一一相好皆是菩薩從初發心堅固菩提，知恩報恩，修是妙行，是故今得無上菩提。」
translation: Each one of these features is a result of a bodhisattva's initial aspiration to firmly establish enlightenment, knowing and repaying kindness, and cultivating this wonderful practice; therefore, he has now attained unsurpassed enlightenment."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如來久於無量阿僧祇劫，至心修持淨戒故，得足下平。
translation: The Buddha said, "Because the Tathāgata had long cultivated pure precepts with the utmost care over measureless incalculable eons, he attained parity at his feet.

source_sentence: 供養父母、和上、師長、有德之人，以是因緣，得足下輪相。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, he makes offerings to his parents, gods, teachers, and people of virtue, and attains the marks of the lower foot of the wheel.

source_sentence: 於諸眾生不生害心，無劫盜想；若見父母、和上、師長有德之人，遠出奉迎，安施床座，恭敬禮拜，破除憍慢，以是因緣，得纖長指。
translation: They don't become harmful to sentient beings or have thoughts of robbery, and if they see their parents, superiors, teachers, and virtuous people, they go out to meet them, give them a seat, venerate them, and refute their pride, and for this reason, they'll attain long, slender fingers.

source_sentence: 具上三行，得足跟傭滿。
translation: Fulfilling the above three practices, they'll attain full employment at the heels.

source_sentence: 以四攝法攝取眾生，以是因緣，得指網縵。
translation: By taking in sentient beings with the four methods of winning them over, he attains a webbed fingertip because of these causes.

source_sentence: 以好酥油摩洗父母、和上、師長、有德之人，以是因緣，得手足柔軟。
translation: He washes his parents, gods, teachers, and people of virtue with good ghee, and because of this cause, he gets soft hands and feet.

source_sentence: 修集善法，不知厭足，以是因緣，得傭[蹲-酋+(十/田/ㄙ)]腸。
translation: He cultivates good qualities and doesn't know when he's tired of them; for this reason, he gets to work [squatting - sheik + (ten/field/thyme)] his intestines.

source_sentence: 聞法歡喜，樂為人說，為法走使，以是因緣，得踝骨不現相。
translation: They rejoice when they hear the teaching, are happy to explain it to others, and walk as a messenger for the teaching; as a result, they'll attain ankle bones that don't show their true form.

source_sentence: 三業清淨，瞻病施藥，破除憍慢，飲食知足，以是因緣，得平立手摩膝相。
translation: He purifies his three activities, looks after illnesses and gives medicine, breaks off pride, and eats and drinks well enough; as a result, he gets the characteristic of standing upright with his hands touching his knees.

source_sentence: 見分離者，善言和合；自修慙愧，亦教人修，以是因緣，得馬藏相。
translation: He speaks well of the harmony of those who see separation, cultivates his own sense of modesty, and teaches others to cultivate it, which is the cause and condition for attaining the mark of a horse's stash.

source_sentence: 自淨三業，亦教人淨；若有眾生四大不調，能為療治，以是因緣，得身圓相。
translation: He purifies the three activities himself and teaches others to purify them; if sentient beings have the four major disorders, he can treat them, and because of this cause, he attains the characteristic of a perfect body.

source_sentence: 聞法歡喜，樂為人說，以是因緣，得身毛上靡相。
translation: They rejoice when they hear the teaching and are happy to explain it to others; because of this cause, they'll attain the characteristic of a body with hair standing straight up.

source_sentence: 思惟諸法，甚深之義，樂修善法，供養父母、和上、師長、有德之人；若行道路，佛塔僧坊，除去塼石、荊棘、不淨，以是因緣，得一一毛右旋相。
translation: They contemplate the profundity of dharmas and delight in cultivating good qualities, making offerings to parents, gods, teachers, and people of virtue, and removing stonework, thorns, and impurities from roads, stūpas, and monasteries as a result of which they attain the characteristic of every hair on the right side.

source_sentence: 若以飲食瓔珞施人，除去瞋心，以是因緣，獲得二相：一者金色，二者常光。
translation: If he gives food and drink to people, removes his anger, and for these reasons, he'll attain two marks: one of gold, and the other of constant radiance.

source_sentence: 以何業緣得一一毛相？
translation: By what karmic conditions does he attain the characteristic of one-hair?

source_sentence: 即此業緣，得身細軟，塵垢不著。
translation: As a result of this action, he attains a fine, flexible body to which dirt and grime don't attach.

source_sentence: 常施眾生所須之物，以是因緣，得七處滿相。
translation: He always gives sentient beings what they need; by these causes and conditions, he attains the full set of seven places.

source_sentence: 自破憍慢，調柔其性，隨眾生心，如法而行，為除不善，教以善法，以是因緣，得上身如師子相，得肩圓相，缺骨平滿相。
translation: He refutes his own pride, pacifies his nature, follows the minds of sentient beings and conducts himself according to the Dharma, removes what's unskillful and teaches them the good Dharma; as a result, he attains the upper body's characteristic of a lion, the characteristic of round shoulders, and the characteristic of a flat, full set of missing bones.

source_sentence: 以何業緣得纖指相？
translation: By what karmic conditions did he attain the characteristic of slender fingers?

source_sentence: 即此業緣，得身傭相。
translation: As a result of this action, he attains the characteristic of a servant in body.

source_sentence: 遠離兩舌，和合鬪諍，以是因緣，得四十齒相，齒密不踈相，齒齊平相。
translation: He's free of duplicity and harmonizes with strife, and because of these causes, he gets the characteristic of forty teeth, the characteristic of close teeth that aren't torn apart, and the characteristic of even teeth.

source_sentence: 修欲界慈，以是因緣，得白齒相。
translation: He cultivates kindness in the desire realm and, as a result, attains the characteristic of white teeth.

source_sentence: 見有求者，歡喜迎送，以是因緣，得方頰車相。
translation: Seeing a seeker, he's joyfully welcomed, and for this reason, he attains the characteristic of a square-cheeked chariot.

source_sentence: 等視眾生，猶如一子，以是因緣，得上味相。
translation: He regards sentient beings equally, just like a son, and because of this cause, he attains the characteristic of superior taste.

source_sentence: 常施眾生無上法味；見有忘者，施其憶念；自持五戒，轉以教人；修集悲心，能大法施，以是因緣，得肉髻相、廣長舌相。
translation: He always gives sentient beings the unsurpassed taste of the Dharma, bestows his memory on those who forget, observes the five precepts himself and teaches them to others, cultivates compassion, and is able to give generously of the Dharma, and for these reasons, he attains the characteristic of a flesh topknot and a broad, long tongue.

source_sentence: 實語，法喜語，法軟語，非時不語，以是因緣，得梵音聲相。
translation: He speaks truly, speaks joyfully, speaks softly, and doesn't speak at non-regulation times, and because of these causes, he attains the characteristics of the voice of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 修集悲心，視諸眾生，猶如父母，以是因緣獲得二相：一者，目紺青色；二者，眼如牛王。
translation: He cultivates a compassionate mind and regards sentient beings as if they were his parents, and because of these causes, he attains two characteristics: one, his eyes are deep blue in color; the other, his eyes are like those of a king bull.

source_sentence: 見有德者，稱實讚歎，以是因緣，得白毫相。
translation: Seeing someone of virtue and praising them in truth, it's the cause and condition for attaining the characteristic of a white tuft of hair.

source_sentence: 三十二相，雖復各各說其因緣，真因緣者，持戒精進。
translation: Although each of the 32 marks is explained as a cause and condition, the true cause and condition is maintaining precepts and making effort.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若不持戒，能修精進，尚不得人身，況得三十二相，無見頂及肉髻相，等無差別。
translation: If someone doesn't observe precepts and cultivates effort, they still won't attain the human body, so how could they attain the thirty-two marks without seeing the top of their head or the shape of their flesh knot, with no distinction between them?

source_sentence: 「復次，凡所作事，定心不悔，以是因緣，得足下平相。
translation: "Furthermore, whenever he does something, he fixes his mind and doesn't repent, and because of this cause, he'll attain the flattened appearance of his feet.

source_sentence: 若至心作，以是因緣，得千輻輪相、第二第三指網縵相、七處滿相、細軟肩圓、缺滿身直、廣長舌相。
translation: If he does it with utmost care, for these reasons, he'll attain the characteristic of a thousand-spoked wheel, the second and third webbed fingers, the full characteristic of seven places, thin and flexible shoulders, a straight body with a full deficiency, and a broad and long tongue.

source_sentence: 若常作者，以是因緣，得長指相、平住摩膝、常光一尋相、齒密不踈相。
translation: If someone is persistent, for these reasons, they'll get the characteristic of long fingers, a flattened knee, a constant light, and a dense, unpatterned tooth.

source_sentence: 若淨作者，以是因緣，獲得餘相。
translation: If this is the cause and condition for a practitioner of purity, he'll attain the other characteristics.

source_sentence: 「復次，若於眾生生淳善心，以是因緣，得手足柔軟、膚體細滑、塵垢不著。
translation: "Furthermore, if this is the cause and condition for producing a pure and good mind toward sentient beings, they'll attain soft hands and feet, fine and smooth skin, and freedom from dirt.

source_sentence: 次第修集，時節修集，以是因緣，得第二、第三、第四相。
translation: Cultivating the collection in sequence and in due time, these are the causes and conditions that give rise to the second, third, and fourth characteristics.

source_sentence: 喜修善法，心無悔退，以是因緣，得金色身、常光齒白、眉間毫相。
translation: They delight in cultivating good qualities, have no regrets, and because of these causes, they attain a golden body, always shining white teeth, and a tuft of hair between their eyebrows.

source_sentence: 若聞讚歎，不生憍慢，覆藏善法，不令人知，以是因緣，得馬藏相。
translation: If someone hears praise, they don't become proud and conceal good qualities from others, and because of these causes, they attain the mark of a horse treasure.

source_sentence: 所修善法，迴向菩提，以是因緣，得一一孔一毛相、身毛上靡、口四十齒、最上味相。
translation: He cultivates good qualities, dedicates them to enlightenment, and because of these causes, he attains the characteristic of one hair in each hole, the hair on his body that rises, the forty teeth in his mouth, and the characteristic of the most excellent taste.

source_sentence: 勤精進故，以是因緣，得方頰車、上身如師子相。
translation: Because of this diligence, and as a result of these causes, he'll attain the characteristic of a square-cheeked chariot and an upper body like a lion.

source_sentence: 至心愛念一切眾生，如視一子，以是因緣，得齒齊平、紺青目、牛王眼相。
translation: He sincerely desires all sentient beings as if he were looking at a single child, and because of this cause, he attains the characteristics of even teeth, deep blue eyes, and the eyes of a bull king.

source_sentence: 修集善法，不知厭足，以是因緣獲得餘相。
translation: He cultivates good qualities and doesn't grow weary of them, and because of these causes and conditions, he attains the other characteristics.

source_sentence: 「菩薩摩訶薩住性行時，修三十二相業。
translation: "When bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas abide in the practice of nature, they cultivate the thirty-two marks of action.

source_sentence: 住淨行時，雖有如是三十二相，相不具足，未得明淨。
translation: When they abide in the practice of purity, even though they have these thirty-two marks, they don't have them in full, and they haven't yet attained clarity.

source_sentence: 住十二行，爾乃了了明顯具足一切佛法。
translation: Abiding in the twelve practices, they then fully comprehended and clearly possessed all the Buddha-dharmas.

source_sentence: 雖無量相，眾生不同，有上中下，不可思議，是故佛說三十二相。
translation: Although there are measureless characteristics, sentient beings are different, and there are higher, middle, and lower levels that are unfathomable; therefore, the Buddha teaches about the thirty-two characteristics.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，所有功德，和合集聚，正與如來一毛相等。
translation: The merits of all sentient beings, when combined and gathered together, are precisely equal to a single hair of the Tathāgata's head.

source_sentence: 一切毛孔所有功德，和合集聚，乃成一好。
translation: The merits of all the pores are combined and gathered together to form a single goodness.

source_sentence: 合集眾好，所有功德，增至百倍，乃成一相，唯除白毫、無見頂相。
translation: When all the merits of those beauties are combined and gathered together, they increase a hundredfold and then become one characteristic, except for the white tuft of hair and the absence of a visible mark on the top of the head.

source_sentence: 合集其餘一切諸相，增至千倍，成是二相。
translation: When he combines and gathers all the other characteristics, it increases a thousandfold and becomes these two characteristics.

source_sentence: 和合集聚三十二相、八十種好所有功德，增至千萬億倍，乃成如來深遠雷音——其聲聞乎無量無邊，不可思議微塵等諸佛世界。
translation: When he combines and gathers together all the merits of the thirty-two marks and eighty kinds of features, it increases a thousand thousand million times to become the profound thundering voice of the Tathāgata-whose sound is heard throughout the unfathomably fragile worlds of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 「為眾生故，行大慈悲，知恩報恩，修集此不可思議甚深微妙，不可思議，如是相好。
translation: "Because of sentient beings, he practices great compassion, knows kindness and returns kindness, and cultivates these unfathomably profound, subtle, and unfathomable features.

source_sentence: 一一相好，能利益無量百千萬億大地微塵等眾生，令發菩提心。
translation: Each one of these attributes can benefit measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of tiny dust particles of sentient beings, causing them to give rise to the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 次第修集，具足得成三十二相好。
translation: Cultivating them in sequence, they fully attain the accomplishment of the thirty-two major characteristics and features.

source_sentence: 具相好已，悉令往趣菩提樹，降魔成佛，轉正法輪，利益眾生，渡渴愛海，到大智岸，成就利益一切眾生。」
translation: Once they possess their major characteristics, they all head for the bodhi tree, subdue Māra, become buddhas, turn the right wheel of the Dharma, benefit sentient beings, cross the ocean of thirst, reach the shore of great wisdom, and accomplish the benefit of all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「一切大眾，諸菩薩摩訶薩等，諸善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "All you people, bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and other good sons!

source_sentence: 汝等誰能常念佛恩，護持正法，書寫讀誦微妙甚深大方便報恩經典？
translation: Who among you can always remember the Buddha's kindness, uphold the true teaching, and write, read, and recite the subtle, profound, and great skillful scriptures that repay kindness?

source_sentence: 誰能於後惡世建大精進，受持擁護阿耨多羅三藐三菩提？
translation: Who will build great zeal in the latter evil age and maintain and uphold unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

source_sentence: 誰能護法，流布此經，於一切眾生作無邊利益？」
translation: Who can protect the Dharma and disseminate this sūtra for the infinite benefit of all sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 爾時大會中有萬八千大菩薩摩訶薩，即從座起，整衣服，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，叉手長跪，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, eighteen thousand great bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas in the assembly rose from their seats, adjusted their robes, bared their right shoulders, knelt on their right knee, saluted with their palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等能於後惡世之中，受持擁護阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，能護正法，教化眾生。」
translation: In the latter evil age, we'll be able to maintain and uphold the unsurpassed, correct teaching and transform sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時師子菩薩復作是言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the lion bodhisattva again said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我亦能以種種方便攝持眾生。」
translation: I'm also able to support sentient beings with various skillful means."

source_sentence: 金剛菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The Vajrapāṇi Bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有眾生當墮三惡道，我能遮持，令不墮落！」
translation: If there are sentient beings who will fall into the three evil destinies, I can prevent them from falling by shielding them!"

source_sentence: 文殊師利復作是言：「世尊！
translation: Mañjuśrī again said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有眾生，凡所求索，我悉能令一切具足。」
translation: If there are sentient beings who ask for anything, I can make it all complete."

source_sentence: 智幢菩薩復作是言：「我能惠施眾生大智。」
translation: The Banner of Wisdom Bodhisattva then said, "I can bestow great wisdom on sentient beings."

source_sentence: 法幢菩薩乃作是言：「世尊！
translation: Then the Dharma Banner Bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能以法普施眾生。」
translation: I can use the Dharma to give it to all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 日光菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The Sunbeam Bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我願施於眾生安樂。」
translation: I want to give to the well-being of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 月光菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: Moonlight Bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能教化一切眾生，令修福德。」
translation: I can teach and transform all sentient beings to cultivate virtue."

source_sentence: 善護菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The Shanhuo Bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能教化一切眾生，令不放逸。」
translation: I can teach and transform all sentient beings so that they don't become careless."

source_sentence: 無盡意菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The Bodhisattva of Inexhaustible Wisdom said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能教化一切眾生，悉令見無盡界義。」
translation: I can teach and teach all sentient beings, and I can make them all see the meaning of the inexhaustible world."

source_sentence: 月上菩薩言：「世尊！
translation: The moon-rising bodhisattva said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能惠施一切眾生無上安樂。」
translation: I can bestow unsurpassed happiness on all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 如是等諸菩薩各自立奇特妙願，莊嚴菩提，利益一切眾生，為念佛恩，為報佛恩故，即從座起，胡跪合掌，而白佛言：「願以此經付囑我等諸菩薩眾。」
translation: Thus, each of these bodhisattvas made a rare and wonderful vow to adorn bodhi and benefit all sentient beings, so in remembrance of the Buddha's kindness and in response to his kindness, they rose from their seats, knelt down with their palms together, and said to the Buddha, "May this sūtra be entrusted to all of us bodhisattvas."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何名此經？
translation: What is the name of this sutra?

source_sentence: 云何奉行？」
translation: How do you practice with reverence?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此經名『攝眾善本』，亦名『大方便』，亦名『微密行』，亦名『佛報恩』。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This sūtra is called 'Collection of Many Good Sources,' which is also called 'Great Skillful Means,' which is also called 'Subtle and Esoteric Practices,' and which is also called 'Buddha's Repayment of Kindness.'"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難及諸大菩薩摩訶薩眾：「汝等當如說修行！」
translation: The Buddha addressed Ānanda and the great crowd of bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, "You must practice as you've been told!"

source_sentence: 說是囑累品時，七萬二千聲聞發無上菩提之心。
translation: When he spoke this chapter on entrustment, 72,000 śrāvakas aroused the mind of unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 及餘一切諸天、龍、鬼神、乾闥婆、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、人非人等，及一切大眾，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: All the other gods, dragons, spirits, gandharvas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans and nonhumans, and all the other people who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 大方便佛報恩經卷第七
translation: Great Skillful Means Sutra on the Buddha's Repayment of Kindness, Volume 7
